headline: 5-Ingredient Easy Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: This easy cookie recipe is made with just 5 ingredients. Fresh baked treats can be yours using a recipe that anyone can make and everyone will love.
name: 5-Ingredient Easy Chocolate Chip Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Sift flour and brown sugar into a bowl; stir in eggs. Mix butter into flour mixture until dough is creamy; fold in chocolate chips. Spoon dough onto a baking sheet, keeping them about 3 inches apart.
Bake in the preheated oven until slightly brown, 10 to 15 minutes. Cool.

review.reviewBody: This reception was so amazing thanks
Absolutely terrible and did not work

I loved this recepie! The only things were it wasn’t as sweet as I would’ve liked it so I added vanilla, and it was a little to thick at first, so I added a splash of milk. After I did those things, they tasted really good! You should totally try this recipe with those small changes.

Unfortunately the negative reviews on this one are legit. I did not read the reviews before making the recipe, which was a mistake. The "cookies" are more like chocolate chip scones, but they do not taste good. They are chewy (not in a good way) and I needed to add additional ingredients to make them actually taste sweet. :( sorry to whomever created this recipe.
Worst chocolate chip recipe I've ever made. Dry and crumbly like scone dough. I'll never make it again.
This recipe is really good I made this with nails on and It was not the hard also if u want to make the cookies crispy put them in for 15 mins instead of 10

Would I make these again? In a pinch, sure. Were they my favorite? No! I decided to tweak the recipe a bit. I made a smaller batch so I did 1.5 cup all purpose flour, 6 tbsp of brown sugar. (Sifted as finely as possible) Then I added 1 egg, room temp butter, and about tbsp of vanilla extract and about 3/4 cup chocolate chips. Once thoroughly mixed I balled them up and placed on a sheet with parchment and a bit of pam and popped them in the freezer for 5 minutes. After that I placed them in the oven on 350 and eyed them 15-18 minutes. Before taking them out I pressed them down because they were still in balls. Texture was kind of like a cookie cake. Big tip: Eat them cooled!!! They taste way better this way!! My way yields about 14-18 cookies depending on size of balls.
These cookies were terrible the worst things I’ve ever had. So dry and plain do NOT make :(
The did tastes like fudge but I did the exact recipe and it ended up being dry and they didn’t even spread apart so they ended up being incoming Dough balls

Please don't use this recipe it's not a chocolate chip cookie recipe it's a biscuit recipe My cookies turned out hard as a rock with no flavor Very disappointed you should take this recipe down because it's not a cookie recipe

There is almost a horrible lack of sweetness in these, honestly, I added another 1/4 cup of melted butter and about 1-1 1/2 cup of powdered sugar and even then it was still super biscuit like and was basically a biscuit with choclate chips, receipe should not be consumed in this current form, 1, add vanilla or some sort of liquid fat (oil or fully melt butter) and decrease flour to 2 cups not 3, 3 is way too much.
Its ok but tends to be more on the buiscuit side. I used exact ingrédients so not sure why.
Ok if you're looking for something sweet and quick but they did not act like normal cookies had to add the white vanilla extract and salt
the recipe was to dry and the cookies didnt spread like normal cookies.. the flavor was good but to dry,, added more butter it didnt help i wont uise it again
these are the best cookies i’ve ever baked. simple easy and tasty

Loved it! Easy, fast, taste great except one thing… too much butter for me. Although I did make a cookie sheet instead of individual cookies and butter was floating on top. Once cooled off soaked in well,but might try with little less butter. But overall great!
Not cookies at all and did not taste good. Waste of time and ingredients
It was cool! and yummy
No baking powder came out hard and not tasty
I think that the recipe was amazing I will make it again that is why it is so good but i think to put is on for like 10 - 15 mins
This recipe was ok. I do think that there was too much flour, so people reading the review, if you do the recipe, and a a little bit less flour.

I was so focused on making choc chip cookies, I jumped at the allure of a 5 ingredient recipe. I wish I would have read the reviews first. After mixing everything together and seeing how dense and dry it was, I checked the reviews to see who had a fix for it. I ended up adding 1 egg white and a teaspoon of vanilla extract and it helped somewhat. Baked the cookies for the full 15 minutes and they came out ok. Still dense, but the flavor wasn't bad. Just not the chocolate cookies we were craving. Lesson learned...always check the reviews first!
Terrible and bland

It was too much flour and they were not good at all. When they were done they were still balls. the flavour is just gross and tastes like way to much flour. If I were you i would do less flour and add some vanilla extract!
This recipe looks amazing. I haven’t tried them yet, they’re in the oven and I added a tiny bit of vanilla extract and didn’t add the chocolate chips but I’m sure they’ll turn out the same

Followed the recipe but added pecans - first batch out of the oven had to be tossed out unfortunately. Added salt to the dough, and it made the rest of the cookies much tastier! If I had to recommend something to change, I would definitely recommend adding salt and white sugar to your dough!
Not a very good cc cookie recipe
This is a horrible recipe I even tried adding vanilla and more sugar. Nothing can help this recipe taste better. Complete waste of ingredients!!!
i was so let down by the end results, they were bland and tasted like dough

Omg these are horrible!!! They def have the shortbread taste to it I even added vanilla to give it a lil flavor and that really didnt give it a much boost. Dont make these unless u know how to tweak these to be cookies.
Worst choc chip cookie recipe ever. Not enough sugar for the amount of flour, the cookies didn’t even melt they stayed in a chunky ball. Needs salt. Do not recommend.

These are not cookies. They are more like a scone with choc chips threw them. However they are easy to make and after reading the recipe and starting to make them I realised there was way to much flour so I cut our half a cup. So my advice would be to put less flour then it says and expect more of a scone cookie.

I don't understand how this recipe got any good reviews. There must have been a mistake in the ingredients. I double-checked my amounts, and I did use correct measurements, but it was so dry and powdery I would not have been able to use it. I looked up other recipes and added more soft butter, sugar, vanilla and water to make it useable. I ended up with edible, but not good, cookies.
Don't waste your time or ingredients!!! So disappointed. My kids won't even eat them! Flavorless, don't bake right. just awful. Really mad at myself right now for taking a chance on this recipe.
This recipe did not work. They did not flatten out in the oven, so the outside was burnt and the inside was raw and dry. The taste was bland and not very good.
Very gross recipe. You can taste the flour with chocolate. No Thank you!!!!!
yes they needed more chips
Horrible flour tasting flour patties. I had to smash them halfway through and once they were done they tasted like a flour cookie. I wouldn’t feed these to my worst enemy.

Horrible. My 9-year-old found the recipe and wanted to try it. They didn’t even melt while cooking. Just stayed a round mound. Three-quarters way through the bake I finally smashed them with a spoon. We should have read the reviews first. Save your ingredients for a better recipe.
It was actually pretty good! I turned them into cookie balls and baked for about 5 minutes longer. Delicious!
Something is missing with these chocolate chip cookies, tasted more like snowball cookies with chocolate chips.

Like some of the other reviews said, these aren't "cookies". Much more scone-like. They're good scones, but not what I was going for in the moment. I think there are too many try ingredients for 2 eggs and a cup of butter to properly soften to cookie-dough consistency.

Added a good amount of salt, big spoonful of honey & a lil bit of oil. A little white sugar and extra chocolate chips. Put them on the tray in spoonfuls and flattened them a bit with back of spoon. 15 min @ 325 F -- Turned out really tasty :) good measurements and omitted the need for baking soda or powder! Not a classic cookie taste but a good craving fix

My husband loves cookies and even he can't stomach them! They taste like flour!
They didn't flatten out like normal cookies would. Yes simple and easy but barely edible!
I followed the recipe but it was too dry.
i made this with my son in 5 minutes, and it took longer to bake but we think these cookies are delicious. He loves them!
This was a waste of time and ingredients. They were incredibly dry and tasteless.
I tried to save them after the first batch but they didn't work. So annoyed that I wasted the time and effort to make these.

To much flour maybe 2 to 2.5 at the max. it was cookie crumble not cookie dough and needed more butter after the flour
Don't recommend this recipe
hmm they are ok i guess they took way more than 20 minutes not the best cookies ever though but they are better then so many cookie recipes i've found on this so yeah
Its good
Inaccurate recipe, the results were horrible, too much flour.

I have to leave a star. otherwise this will get no star from me. smh this was so bad. the essentials needed to bake a cookie is MIA. i should have known that it would be bad because the batter tasted awful. never ever again.

This recipe was delicious! My friend and I are making a bake sail for my neighborhood. Instead if 1 cup of chocolate chips, I did 1/2 cup of chocolate chips and 1/2 cup of rainbow sprinkles! Adding the sprinkles makes it taste super good!
Worst recipe; waste of time and good ingredients! Very dry & tasteless!
horrible my family didnt not like them at all.

First and foremost, if you're looking for a great cookie recipe, this is not it. Too much flour, and it could possibly use more butter. "It's a chocolatey Biscuit." In all, it's not something I would make again.
Easy to make, but terrible taste. It needs baking powder or it becomes a brick and doesn't cook well.

I changed the recipe and instead of 2 eggs, did 1 banana (not too ripe but still softish). I also added some vanilla extract because some reviewers said the recipe might taste bland. Everything else I followed exactly and this is how they turned out! They were delicious!! ** I also put the dough in the freezer for about 5 minutes before baking**

The rating for the recipe is a 2..
For the add-ons I placed it made it a 4...

Note these cookies don't leave the shape of how you made them!!! 

So the recipe is dry and bland. I doubled the batch and added another cup of sugar as well as 2 tps of vanilla extract. I set aside my left over chocolate chips and melted them. Once the cookies where done I ended up dunking the cookies into the chocolate completely coating them and setting them solidify again. It most definitely saved the cookie from it's blandess and also gave it a delicious taste. Heck of a recovery.
Ratio of flour was too much. Tasted like cardboard with chocolate chips. Disappointed.
Easy dessert for a broke college student who wants to stress-bake but doesn't have the time or money to go out and buy ingredients just for cookies.
I added 1 1/2 cup chips. They didn’t need to cook as long , cut cook time by 2 to 3 mins
I just dump evrything into a bowl and mix. Even my Dad likes it.

The spooning onto the baking sheet part meant they came out ugly, so next time I'll try rolling them. My son devoured two before they'd even fully cooled so I'm guessing that means they turned out okay other than the shape.
This made my day! The highlight of my year! I just loved it so much!

I don't agree that this recipe makes a tasteless cookie! It is simple and not over-sweet, which I like because it highlights the chocolate chips---or any other add you want to make. This is a basic recipe---so you can embellish it anyway you like..add more sugar, use really dark sugar instead of brown sugar, add vanilla or nuts or coconut or cherries...the dough's simplicity will make the star of the show what you add, rather then over powering the fruit or nuts or whatever.
easy to make, but didn't come out good, too floury

It would be more filling if there was oatmeal in them. Just a suggestion!
Otherwise they are great!
I will definitely make this again for the butter so it’s not so dry and clumpy make sure u melt the butter before adding it into the batter it made it a lot easier to mix. Thx for this awesome recipe
It lacks the required ingredients to make it good.

IF I COULD GET AWAY WITHOUT ANY STARS IT WOULDN'T HAVE ANY.....

This recipe sucks I know what to call these things it made but they sure ain't no chocolate chip cookies and are so gross even after trying to doctor the recipe they still won't come out like a chocolate chip cookie is suppose to. Uckkkk 
Is there any that do you out right that are pretty basic and quick without all the usual ingredients?
Taste more flour. Not much flavor at all. Very dry.
Easy to follow, it's what you'd expect with so little ingredients. Definitely a chocolate chip cookie, but a little bland.

This recipe is WILD. My housemates and I wanted to make cookies but got something much more unique than that. These are not cookies–let's make that clear–but these scone-like concoctions are addictive. They're a house favorite for sure.

These definitely cook up more like shortbread, but are easy and tasty.

I halved the recipe, went up to a full 1/2 cup on the sugar, added 1/2 tsp of vanilla, and loved it!

If you use the peanut butter cookie process of using a fork to make a crisscross on top, they flatten beautifully.
Didn't like them they didn't spread out just became little knots.
Did not care for these at all. Wanted to make these for my family because it's a wonderful day out- perfect for cooking. I'm out of chocolate chips and this killed my mood. 0/10 would recommend.
These cookies were dry and floury they need more butter and or eggs.

It was very doughy, I think there was too much flour. I rolled the dough into balls and placed them on the sheet and when I pulled them out, they were still in balls and the bottoms were burnt. I think maybe add less four and more brown sugar with vanilla extract.
They are thick and taste like shortbread. I love it I love it I love It!
Do NOT try these. They are a waste of ingredients. So dry and tasteless.
This was the worst recipe ever for chocolate chip cookies. Waste of materials it should really be removed from online if I could give it to zero Stars I would.........

It didn’t work,
It was too dry so I added water and now won’t cook properly
Ended up really tasty! Loved it!
Chocolate chip cookies??? Um more like chocolate chip bland bread. Beware

If you aren't looking for a basic quick pantry cookie- just find another recipe. To make this better and still keep 5 ingredients double the sugar and the chocolate chips. or to improve this recipe while keeping it simple add a pinch of salt and some vanilla extract. to lighten the cookies whip the butter and sugar first. recommend smaller cookies baked until crunchy.

5 stars for fast, simple/easy, and a great base/leaves room to get creative. I use all organic ingredients. Know that the cookies don't flatten out at all. Also, I love dunking my cookies and these were perfect for that. You can substitute anything you want in them, too. I always add tooons of chocolate (I just chop up a dark choc bar), my husband likes peanut butter cups, my grandma likes walnuts, raisins, and spice.
Terrible! So gross
First time I've ever baked anything. Very easy to follow but no flavor and pretty dry.
Dry.
Need to add the yield
Mine turned out really dry and somewhat tasteless. I have much better recipes that I can use. Thanks but will pass on making this one again.
Super easy and delicious. Of course, I added a bit of cinnamon/nutmeg to spice things up
Seemed like the recipe was missing something. There wasn't much flavour to the cookie and it was a little crunchy. But they were okay...

This was an okay recipe. Very easy to make with a few ingredients that are usually on hand. I felt they lacked the flavor that most chocolate chip cookies have. Without a leavening agent they were only as thick as you make them; they were kind of dense. Overall, these wouldn't be at the top of my list, but were quick and easy enough that I would use them again in a pinch.
